title: User-Centric Data Access Control
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to have granular permission settings for accessing my patients' health data so that I can monitor their health effectively while respecting their privacy preferences.

title: Intuitive User Interface Design – Simplified Navigation for Caregivers
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want an intuitive interface that allows me to quickly access critical patient health information without complicated setup, so that I can efficiently monitor my patients' well-being and respond to their needs.

title: Real-Time Health Data Synchronization for Remote Monitoring
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to receive real-time health data from my patients' monitoring devices so that I can track their health metrics efficiently and identify early warning signs without needing to be physically present.

title: Comprehensive User Training Resources – Interactive Video Tutorials for Independent Learning
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to access interactive video tutorials to explore system features at my own pace so that I can independently learn how to use ALFRED effectively to support my rural patients.

title: Multi-Channel Notification System for Health Alerts
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to receive timely health alerts through multiple channels so that I can monitor my patients' health status efficiently and respond to any anomalies proactively.

title: Cross-Platform Health Data Integration
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want to integrate third-party health applications with ALFRED so that I can monitor my patients' health metrics from various devices seamlessly and generate insights for personalized care.

title: Adaptive Learning and Support
summary: As a home-care nurse, I want the ALFRED system to adapt to my usage patterns and preferences so that I can efficiently monitor my patients' health and explore features at my own pace without feeling overwhelmed.
